intro: Galium pedemontanum, commonly known as the Pedemontan bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium pedemontanum is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
